==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=8|rs=木06}}

# the [[katsura]], the Japanese Judas tree
# the [[cinnamon]] or [[cassia]] tree
# the sweet [[osmanthus]] tree

====Readings====
{{ja-readings|goon=[[かい]] (kai)|kanon=[[けい]] (kei)|kun=[[かつら]] (katsura), [[めかつら]] (mekatsura)|nanori=[[かつ]] (katsu), [[よし]] (yoshi), [[か]] (ka)}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|丹桂|たんけい}}: golden osmanthus (''[[Osmanthus fragrans]]'')
* {{ja-r|桂子|^けいこ}}: a female given name
* {{ja-r|桂飴|かつら あめ}}: a type of [[sweet]] traditionally sold in villages in the mountains around Kyōto Prefecture
* {{ja-r|桂鮎|かつら あゆ}}: [[ayu]] ([[sweetfish]]) caught in the Katsura River in Kyōto
* {{ja-r|桂庵|けいあん}}: a [[mediary]] in an arranged marriage or in a [[lawsuit]]; a hiring [[placement]] specialist
* {{ja-r|桂園|^けいえん}}: [[pseudonym]] for {{m|ja|香川景樹|tr=Kagawa Kageki}}, a poet during the late {{w|Edo Period}}
* {{ja-r|桂園一枝|^けいえん ^いっし}}: a private [[anthology]] of poetry printed towards the end of the {{w|Edo Period}}
* {{ja-r|桂園派|^けいえんは}}: a style of {{m|ja|和歌|tr=waka}} poetry, founded by {{m|ja|香川景樹|tr=Kagawa Kageki}}
* {{ja-r|桂科|かつらか}}: the [[Cercidiphyllaceae]] [[family]], containing only the ''[[Cercidiphyllum]]'' [[genus]], containing only the two [[species]] ''[[Cercidiphyllum japonicum]]'' and {{taxlink|Cercidiphyllum magnificum|species|noshow=1}}, both commonly called {{m|ja|桂|tr=katsura}}
* {{ja-r|桂花|けいか}}, {{ja-r|桂華|けいか}}: {{qualifier|metaphor}} the [[moon]], from a Chinese legend of trees growing on the moon
* {{ja-r|桂冠|けいかん}}: a [[laurel]] [[wreath]]
* {{ja-r|桂冠詩人|けいかん しじん}}: a [[poet]] [[laureate]]
* {{ja-r|桂巻|かつら まき}}: a style of women's head wrapping popular during the {{w|Muromachi Period}}, using a long piece of cloth tied in front above the forehead
* {{ja-r|桂宮|^かつら-の-みや}}: one of the four {{m|ja|親王家|tr=shinnōke||branches of the Imperial Family of Japan which were eligible to succeed to the Chrysanthemum Throne in the event that the main line should die out}}
* {{ja-r|桂宮院|^けいきゅういん}}, {{ja-r|桂宮院|^けいぐういん}}: the inner temple building at the {{w|Hōryū-ji|Hōryūji Temple}} in Kyoto
* {{ja-r|桂月|けいげつ}}: alternate word for {{m|ja|月|tr=tsuki||the moon}}; the eighth [[lunar month]]
* {{ja-r|桂湖村|^かつら ^こそん}}: a Japanese author, lived 1868-1934
* {{ja-r|桂江|^けいこう}}: a river in the Chūgoku region of Japan
* {{ja-r|桂三木助|^かつら ^みきすけ}}: a traditional Japanese comedian ({{m|ja|落語|tr=rakugo}} performer); the first by this name lived 1894-1943, the second lived 1902-1961
* {{ja-r|桂枝|けいし}}: a [[branch]] from a [[cassia]], [[katsura]], [[laurel]], or [[cinnamon]] tree; a branch from the [[legendary]] tree that grows on the [[moon]]
* {{ja-r|桂芝|けいし}}: alternate word for {{m|ja|万年茸|tr=mannentake}}, a type of [[mushroom]]
* {{ja-r|桂樹|けいじゅ}}: common name for various trees in [[family]] [[Lauraceae]], particularly the [[cinnamon]] or [[cassia]] trees; a legendary tree growing on the moon; alternate for {{m|ja|浜枇杷|tr=hamabiwa||a type of tree in the genus {{taxlink|Litsea|genus|noshow=1}}, related to the [[laurel]]}}
* {{ja-r|桂秋|けいしゅう}}: alternate word for {{m|ja|秋|tr=aki||autumn}}
* {{ja-r|桂春団治|^かつら ^はるだんじ}}: [[stage name]] for {{m|ja|川田藤吉|tr=Kawada Fujiyoshi}}, a {{m|ja|落語|tr=rakugo||traditional Japanese comedy}} performer in [[Ōsaka]], lived 1881-1937
* {{ja-r|桂女|かつらめ}}: a type of {{m|ja|巫女|tr=miko||shrine maiden}}; a woman selling of ''katsura ayu'' and ''katsura ame'' in areas around old Kyōto; a [[prostitute]] from the village of Katsura near Kyōto; a [[noblewoman]]'s [[bridesmaid]] in ancient Japan
* {{ja-r|桂小五郎|^かつら ^こごろう}}: former name of {{m|ja|木戸孝允|tr={{w|Kido Takayoshi}}}}, an important [[politician]] in the late {{w|Edo Period}} and early {{w|Meiji Period}}
* {{ja-r|桂昌院|^けいしょういん}}: [[concubine]] of {{m|ja|徳川家光|tr={{w|Tokugawa Iemitsu}}}}, the third Tokugawa [[shōgun]]
* {{ja-r|桂心|けいしん}}: [[cinnamon]] or [[cassia]] bark, as used in cooking; {{taxlink|Cinnamomum tenuifolium|species|noshow=1}}, Japanese cinnamon; a type of [[mochi]] [[confection]] coated in cinnamon [[powder]]
* {{ja-r|桂仙花|けいせんか}}: alternate word for {{m|ja|翁草|tr=okinagusa}}, {{taxlink|Pulsatilla cernua|species|noshow=1}}, a type of low-growing [[anemone]]

[[File:Cercidiphyllum_japonicum2.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|桂（カツラ）の[[葉っぱ]]と[[実#Japanese|実]]}}]]
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|かつら|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かつら}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かつら|香|tr1=ka|t1=fragrance, good smell|出|tr2=zu|t2=to come out, to put something out}} + {{m|ja|ら|tr=ra|pos=nominalizing suffix}}: "that which puts out a good smell", from the way the wood smells good.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かつら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|楓}} {{qualifier|uncommon}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かつら}}

# the [[katsura]] tree, ''[[Cercidiphyllum japonicum]]'', also called the Japanese Judas tree
# less commonly, the smaller {{taxlink|Cercidiphyllum magnificum|species|noshow=1}} tree, more specifically called the {{ja-l|広葉桂}} or {{m|ja|ヒロハカツラ|tr=''[[hiroha katsura]]''||broadleaf katsura}}.
# a tree on the [[moon]], from a Chinese legend that the phases of the moon were caused by [[Lauraceae]] trees budding, blossoming, then dropping their flowers and leaves again as if in accelerated seasons
# [[julienne]]d [[raw]] [[daikon]], used as a [[garnish]] for [[sashimi]]
# alternate word for {{m|ja|肉桂|tr=nikkei||the cinnamon or cassia tree}} or {{m|ja|桂皮|tr=keihi||cinnamon or cassia bark}}

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|桂男|かつら おとこ}}: the katsura man, a character in the Chinese legend who lives on the moon

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|かつら}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=かつら}}
# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=かつら}}
# the west [[bank]] of the Katsura River in Kyōto

[[File:Cinnamomum_verum1.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|桂（めかつら）の[[葉っぱ]]と[[実#Japanese|実]]}}]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|めかつら}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=めかつら}}. Alternate spelling for {{m|ja|女桂|tr=mekatsura||female katsura}}, an archaic name for the [[cinnamon]] tree. Compare {{m|ja|男桂|tr=okatsura||male katsura: the katsura tree}}. Appears with this reading in the {{m|ja|和名類聚抄|tr={{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}}}, a Japanese dictionary of Chinese characters completed in 938.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|めかつら}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-r|女桂|めかつら}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|めかつら}}

# the [[cinnamon]] tree, or other closely related trees in [[genus]] ''[[Cinnamomum]]''

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|肉桂|にっけい}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=けい}} {{m|zh|桂}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|けい|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|けい}}

# the [[cinnamon]] or [[cassia]] tree
# common name for various other trees in [[family]] [[Lauraceae]]
# in China, the {{m|ja|木犀|tr=mokusei}} or [[sweet osmanthus]] tree

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|cinnamon or cassia}} {{ja-r|肉桂|にっけい}}
* {{sense|sweet osmanthus}} {{ja-r|木犀|もくせい}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|yomi=o}}
From a Chinese legend that the phases of the moon were caused by ''kei'' trees, which would bud, blossom, then drop their flowers and leaves again as if in accelerated seasons.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|けい}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|けい}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=けい|euphemistic}} the [[moon]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|月|つき}}
* {{ja-r|桂花|けいか}}

[[File:Shogi_knight.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|将棋の'''桂'''}}]]

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|yomi=o}}
Abbreviation of {{m|ja|桂馬|tr=keima}}, the [[knight]] in {{m|ja|将棋|tr=[[shōgi]]||Japanese chess}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|けい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|けい}}

# the [[knight]] in {{m|ja|将棋|tr=[[shōgi]]||Japanese chess}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|桂馬|けいま}}
